revised_title: Gastrolith Function in Marine Tetrapods: Buoyancy Control or Food Processing?
tldr: This article examines the occurrence and function of gastroliths, or stomach stones, in marine tetrapods. The author argues that gastroliths primarily serve as a means of buoyancy control rather than food processing, based on a comparative analysis of their distribution among different marine tetrapod groups. The study also discusses the potential role of gastroliths in various aspects of marine tetrapod biology and evolution.
